articles.title: U.S. to evacuate Americans trapped on quarantined cruise ship off Japan
articles.description: American passengers can get on the plane only if they test negative for the new coronavirus. Then they face another 14-day quarantine at a California military base. The government said the passengers will be “unable to return to the United States for a period…

articles.author: Bill Neely and Isobel van Hagen
articles.title: 'Holding me hostage': Tensions high for Americans on quarantined cruise ship
articles.description: U.S. passengers aboard the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Tokyo have expressed concerns about plans to evacuate them.
articles.content:
HONG KONG A passenger aboard a cruise ship quarantined in Japan because of the coronavirus, has accused the U.S. government of "holding me hostage" ahead of a planned evacuation on Sunday.
Karey Maniscalco told NBC News via Skype that she was being treated l… [+2817 chars]

articles.author: Dr. Jonathan Kolby
articles.title: How love for an endangered animal inspired a new wave of coronavirus racism
articles.description: Dialogues about the new coronavirus should not allow the important topic of wildlife conservation to provide a smokescreen for prejudice.
articles.content: Last week, rumors began circulating that endangered pangolins also known as scaly anteaters might have been the intermediate host that allowed the deadly new coronavirus disease COVID-19 to spread from bats to humans, based on unpublished research findings an… [+8094 chars]

articles.author: Alexander Smith, Eric Baculinao
articles.title: Coronavirus: China's Xi Jinping faces his biggest challenge
articles.description: The COVID-19 epidemic is the latest in a string of challenges for President Xi of China.
articles.content:
The coronavirus outbreak has killed almost 1,400 people in China, spread to over two dozen countries and created a global health crisis. It is also the biggest challenge yet facing President Xi Jinping since he became leader of China in 2012.
Some say it may… [+7021 chars]

articles.author: Dennis Romero and Segilola Arisekola
articles.title: More U.S. passengers on quarantined ship can finally exit
articles.description: The U.S. State Department said it's coordinating with Japanese authorities to offer qualifying passengers of the Diamond Princess a way ashore.
articles.content:
More American passengers on a cruise ship quarantined off Japan as a result of the global spread of novel coronavirus will be offered a way ashore, U.S. diplomatic officials said late Friday.
But the exit will come with a caveat: Travelers, once on dry land,… [+2773 chars]
